description: Operating guided tours, Niagara Falls tours on the Ontario side of the falls and on the USA side of the falls. Lighthouse immersive tickets for: Van Gogh, Monet, Frida and King Tut.

reviews.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY!!!
text: We paid  $150 + dollars for a ridiculous rip off.   Read the reviews, they are making insane money hand over fist for this.   Be prepared to be disappointed and feeling like you WASTED money.   Save yourself and don’t go.

reviews.title: Disappointing unremarkable
text: Should have investigated further before buying tickets as this had nothing to do with King Tut’s life, simply his journey into the afterlife following his death. We felt that while the visuals were nice to look at, the actual story was not. For the amount we paid the length was quite short and the tale was unremarkable. The building it took place in had lumps in the wall for pillars and pipes that distracted from the visuals. No one was monitoring the area so there were children running around disrupting the experience. We had gone to Van Gogh and thought it was a stunning retelling of the life and art of Van Gogh. Thought we’d enjoy this experience for the same reason. King Tut paled in comparison and unfortunately would not recommend.

reviews.title: Waste of money
text: Totally disappointed and not worth a tenth of the price.  A film of statues on a boat goes around the room.  A very big computer projects this boring animation on the walls and floors.  I guess the sand on the floor and the smell of cinnamon are supposed to make it immersing.

reviews.title: King Tut Toronto - worst show ever
text: Misleading. Not worth the price
Do not recommend
There was almost nothing about history
The chairs were not comfortable and there was almost no immersion or interaction

reviews.title: TERRIBLE DO NOT GO
text: This was absolutely awful.   Not as advertised.    Was like a bad children’s story book.  There was no focus on the artifacts and the quality of the picture was poor.

reviews.title: Do NOT waste your money
text: What a rip off! A complete waste of time, money, and my Sunday afternoon. There was no point to the show- the narrator was just rumbling on and saying things that made no sense. Clearly had zero understanding of history or anything real. The graphics were mediocre- looks like someone got high and decided to do an art project that didn’t turn out as hoped. Stay away!

reviews.title: Don’t go
text: This is not an exhibit - no artifacts - and, except for a few short, Wikipedia quality blurbs one can read on the wall at the start,  it is not about King Tut.
Misleading name and advertising aside, I would have been open to a better review if it was any good.  It was not.  35 minutes of slow moving,
poor quality computer generated graphics set to a choppy, sparse narrative about nothing.

reviews.title: How to be ripped off in a half hour
text: I really wish I could give this a -100 rating as it was a total rip off . I paid the extra for the VIP package and received nothing except for my landyard and a cushion to sit on during this 30 minute very boring movie and there was less than a half of room with fake artifacts.  I came to see it from Goderich so it also cost me the price of a train ticket to get down to see it. They make it look so good on their facebook page but when you arrive its shocking to see how little this presentation consists of. We also noticed the staff wouldn't look us right is the eyes as they probably realize how they are ripping people off.  They should be investigated and charged for all the money they have stolen from people thinking this is a one of a kind show worth seeing ..... which it is definitely not  The pictures I attached is basically the whole display .....not much . Hopefully all these bad reviews found here will help you save money as they keep deleting the bad reviews and keeping the good ones that were probably written by their staff as there is nothing good about this display and taking good money from people just to see the expressions of shock when we realized we had just been ripped off

reviews.title: Save your time and money.
text: If I could give it less than 1, I would. I paid for VIP yet got to sit in fake sand watching a lame 35 minute video. These people are ripping people off with this "immersive experience". Dont waste your time or money. I asked for a refund and was refused.
Plus they are also removing whatever poor reviews and comments they get on social media. As well as blocking people who leave negative comments.
Its a bit of a scam.

reviews.title: False advertising
text: The whole experience is a farce.

All you do is go into a room with columns and sand on the floor and watch a made up story of King Tut’s journey into the afterlife.  The PowerPoint like movie lasts about 25 minutes and then everyone in the room is left stunned at the fact that they all got ripped off.  People were either leaving angrily or laughing at it. I am honestly surprised that this falsely advertised experience has not been closed down for misrepresentation.

reviews.title: Stay home and watch a documentary on Tut instead!
text: This was a huge disappointment! The title is very misleading - it really has nothing to do with King Tut, it's a pretend journey to the underworld and the premise behind it is that it's King Tut who has died. The entire thing was only 35 minutes long and really had no content. Save your money!

reviews.title: Unbelievably disappointing
text: It was terrible!

First I bought premium tickets thinking the cushion I'd get might actually be nice and would be something to do with King Tut and could be kept on the couch. It was a cheap little plasticized rectangle, which was to do with Klimt (a different experience). Then I also liked the idea of being able to get in up to an hour early.

As it was, we arrived 20 minutes early and we were courteously allowed in and were told that the show would start at 12:50!! It was only 12:10 (our start time was 12:30pm) So, an early start time only meant we could get into the "holding pen" early. I had no idea it was a "show" with start times. The fact that you could get in up to an hour early led me to believe that it was a self guided walk through and being let in early meant you would start walking through earlier and would maybe have more time to peruse everything.

But no. We were stuck in this room. It was interesting enough but you needed all of 10 or 15 minutes to check it all out.  Problem being, I was there with my 87 year old mother and my 76 year old aunt and uncle and although they're perfectly mobile, standing for long periods is not an option. Thankfully, I found a handful of folding chairs tucked away in a dark corner and we sat.

When the doors to the next room finally opened, by the time we got inside, all the seating was taken and everyone else was milling about or sitting on the floor on their cushions; hardly an option for my family members. So I popped back out and grabbed a couple of chairs for my mum and my aunt. I figured we surely wouldn't be there for long, imagining that we would move on into other rooms. Alas, no. We sat there for 40 minutes watching what essentially amounted to a sort of realistic cartoon depicting the journey that the ancient Egyptians believed a dead pharaoh would take through the underworld. It had virtually nothing to do with King Tutankhamen in particular and certainly had nothing to do with the discovery or excavation of his tomb. I imagined seeing the pyramids and the endless dunes and images of Carter's expedition.
For 4 Egyptian Canadians it was deeply disappointing; in terms of quality and content as well as tickets and pricing. If you want to see it anyway, do NOT bother with premium tickets!!

reviews.title: Big disappointment
text: Very cheap CGI animations. Poor content. Very disappointed. Not for history enthusiasts. Some people left before the end of the projection.
Not worth spending 25-35$…

reviews.title: Lame! Stay Home!
text: They should be honest about how lame the presentation is. Almost no commentary, 4 little benches to seat 100 people. Low resolution graphics, which didn't fit the walls they were projected onto.
Felt scammed by the whole affair.

reviews.title: Excitement turned to disappointment
text: I had been looking forward to seeing the  Immersive King Tut presentation and booked tickets for my brothers and sister-in-law. We had all gone to see the King Tut exhibit at the ROM back in the late 70s and had hoped to learn more about the discovery of the tomb, what the discoverers saw when they entered it, and see some of the artifacts included in the video presentation. Instead, it was a 40 minute animation-type video without much in the way of interesting facts. It was like watching a glorified TV show, and one that wasn't very interesting. I wanted so badly to like the presentation, but I definitely didn't.

reviews.title: Super Disappointing
text: Poorly made, super disappointing! The story has no real connection to the tomb, discovery, and life of King Tut. The majority of the audience fell asleep some even walk out. Bad graphics and pictures are like screenshots. It was like a PowerPoint presentation shown on the big screen with a dated screen transitioning. Super waste of time and money. Please don't go unless you want to have a terrible day.

reviews.title: NOT GOOD. Save your money.
text: Because I can not give it a “cero”
I what a waste of money and time
Do NOT aspens tour money on it.
The entrance’s history is the most important and interesting part. Again: save your bucks

reviews.title: Awful. Waste of time and money
text: This was a giant waste of time and money. The graphics are very sub par. The story of The Boy King waffled on and felt like a piece of fiction and not factual history. Please don’t waste your time or money on this event.

reviews.title: Incredibly bad experience
text: Surprised my daughter for her birthday and all of us were very disappointed.    The animation was extremely poor quality and the storyline was even weaker.  If you are looking to learn anything about King Tut, this is not place.  If you are looking to be entertained with some high tech projectors and sound effects, unfortunately this misses the mark again.  Considering the cost, I felt strongly enough to write this review so that other people don't waste their money.

reviews.title: Awful.
text: Don’t waste your money!!  My mother in law really wanted to go to this, so my husband and I drove and figured we’d make a day of it.  It was so disappointing.

When I was purchasing the tickets, it felt super scammy.  There was a $6 booking fee, lots of “selling out fast!” prompts, and a bunch of VIP options which didn’t look like they amounted to much.  I had a bad feeling at this point but went ahead.

We got to the location only to realize that there was NO parking as it’s right next to Queen’s Quay.  We parked about a 15 minute walk away for a whopping $40, after spending $40 in gas to drive to Toronto.

We were on time, but rushed into the “theatre”.  It was a large warehouse room, with projectors set up.  There was some seating, but we stayed standing figuring that we’d be able to walk around the room and then move to the next room.  Oh no.  It was JUST that room.  A “movie” that felt like it was written by a highschool kid played, that had NOTHING to do with King Tut, and virtually no history.  It was a pretend imagining of what it might be like in the afterlife.  What?!  All the material you could have covered, and that’s what you chose?

The projections itself were so strange, like a bad video game.  The idea is neat, but we thought it would be a 3D model of the tomb you could walk through, or pictures of artifacts.  Not even close.  It looked like someone went crazy with PowerPoint transitions on a slide deck.  Just a bunch of crumbling rock turning into a bunch of hieroglyphics that then turned into water… it was incredibly boring.
The “movie” ended abruptly, the guy just stopped talking and the pictures stopped moving.  I checked my phone, and we’d been there 32 minutes.
Everyone just kind of sat looking at each other going “that was it?” I thought there was no way, there had to be more…. So I poked my head out the exit, and sure enough, it went into the lobby.

It was a joke.  For $40 this was so awful.  I would have been upset paying $5.  I literally would rather have watched The Mummy with Brenden Fraser and probably would have gotten more actual history out of it.
Stay away from this.  I won’t bother with any of the other immersive exhibits if this is what they are like.

reviews.title: Short, uni formative and poorly written
text: Extremely underwhelming and disappointing. Lots of abstract images and poor storyline. There were a couple of moments with images of ancient walls, hieroglyphics, torches and of statues but most were of simplistic computer graphics. No reenactment or dramatization. Nothing to learn: there was more information before one went into the room. During our viewing, we did hear a single expression of appreciation from the audience. Totally turned off any immersive show.

reviews.title: Disgusting, waste of $$
text: A HUGE waste of 20-30 minutes.  Not what we expected. The story of the boy King was left out, zero artifacts, zero coverage about the discovery of the tombs. It was basically a video about the underworld, whatever that it! They sell seats as part of the VIP package.  The seat is a cushion on a floor covered in sawdust and you get a poster. We sat on all the FREE chairs provided. The security told us they’ve heard ALOT of negative reviews. They sent us to Bob Marley exhibit as a compensation. It definitely made up for the waste of time Tut was!

reviews.title: Terrible / mediocre
text: Terrible ! Huge disappointment !
The show was not as advertised !
Nothing to do with king tut …. For this price you would expect more but it was just a 30 mins show.
Nothing wow ….
Save your money!

reviews.title: King Tut comes to life- Incredible
text: I felt like I landed in egypt. This was Beautiful and the set up incredible. I dont love exhibits but this brought it to life. I think this is the only way I can with an exhibit about history. Great job we really enjoyed.
